title: Rolf Johannessen
text:
Rolf Johannessen (15 March 1910 – 2 February 1965) was a <a href="Norway">Norwegian</a> <a href="football%20defender">football defender</a>.
Career.
He played for <a href="Norway%20national%20football%20team">Norway</a> in the <a href="1938%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1938 FIFA World Cup</a>. He was capped 20 times for Norway.
At club level, he played for <a href="Lisleby%20FK">Lisleby</a>, then <a href="Fredrikstad%20FK">Fredrikstad</a> from 1934. He also played football while taking education in <a href="Saarland">Saarland</a>, and became Saar champion. In Norway he won two league titles and four <a href="Norwegian%20football%20cup">cup</a> titles.
After retiring he chaired Fredrikstad FK from 1950 to 1953 and 1960 to 1962. He was an honorary member of the club. He died in February 1965 at Fredrikstad Hospital.
